snippet: Officials warned that airstrikes alone would not be sufficient to protect the Syrian town of Kobani from the Islamic State fighters.
abstract: Obama administration officials say there are limits to what United States is able or willing to do to defend Syrian town Kobani, as fighters from Islamic State are on brink of seizing town near Turkish border.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: Officials warned that airstrikes alone would not be sufficient to protect the Syrian town of Kobani from the Islamic State fighters.

headline.main: As Islamic State Nears Conquest of Syrian Town, U.S. Presses Turks
headline.print_headline: As Islamic State Nears Conquest, U.S. Presses Turks

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
